full_summary:
# Low Level Chlorine Intake – Screen Replacement and Chlorine Injection System Commissioning

## Tender Information

### Notice Data

* Reference Number: 21450-25-4623906
* Solicitation Number: 21450-25-4623906
* Publication Date: 2024-01-22
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-02-22T13:30:00
* Amendment Date: 2024-02-22
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-02-15
* Expected Contract End Date: 2024-05-31

### Tender Status

* Status (English): Expired
* Status (French): Expiré

## Procurement Details

* Procurement Category: CNST
* Procurement Method: Competitive – Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Variations of the above methods
* Trade Agreements: North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)

### Tender Description

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requires a qualified contractor to replace the existing intake screen at the low level intake structure at Joyceville Institution. The contractor will also be responsible for inspecting the intake line and chlorine feed line, repairing the existing shear in the intake piping, and commissioning the chlorine injection system as a zebra mussel deterrent.

### Scope of Work

* Replace the existing intake screen
* Inspect and repair the intake line and chlorine feed line
* Repair the existing shear in the intake piping
* Commission the chlorine injection system
* Provide a continuous water supply to the Institution during construction
* Meet the requirements outlined in Annex E – Technical Specifications and Annex F – Engineered Drawings

### Requirements

* Environmental Mitigation Measures: The contractor must follow mitigating measures and best practices as per the Environmental Mitigation Measures Forms in compliance with the Impact Assessment Act (IAA) requirements.
* All work must meet the requirements outlined in the Ministry of Environment, Conservation and Parks Design Guidelines for Drinking Water Systems (Ontario) and applicable criteria outlined by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO).

You can copy and paste it in your solution. Please be noted that extra white lines are added by me to make your rewritten text clearer and easier to follow. The original text with many lines will cause duplication of lines in your output. 

Please adjust your rewritten result with the correct white line usage.
